title.narrative: 4.3 QUALITY BASIC EDUCATION

description.narrative: By 2020, Government is equipped with tools and skills to better formulate and implement programmes for inclusive and quality general secondary education for all children, which contributes to Cross-Sectoral Communication For Development, Equitable Access To Quality Education, Equitable Access To Quality Education (Covid), Learning Outcomes, Other Cross-Sectoral Programme Areas, Skills Development. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Evaluations, Research And Data, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: 4. By 2020, girls and boys benefit equitably from improved preschool education and enhanced quality of basic education including in emergencies.

title.narrative: By 2020, Government is equipped with tools and skills to better formulate and implement programmes for inclusive and qualitygeneral secondary education for all children

description.narrative: UNICEF supported the government in;introducing;systematic and comprehensive curricular, pedagogic,;assessment;and textbook;reforms in;the;basic education sectorin Uzbekistan based on thenewcompetency-basedNational Curriculum Framework (NCF);;specialists working in curricular areas were equipped with enhanced skills and knowledge to implement reforms adhering to the modern concepts; and;the UNICEF-supported Distance Learning;programme;during COVID-19 pandemic ensured;that;5000+;video lessons;had;reached;around;5.8 million;children;in grades 1-11,;ensuring their learning;continuity.;;; | Status:Met | As-of Date:22/01/2021
